intro: Cottendorfia serrulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cottendorfia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
